Baby Boomers are less likely to indicate that talking on a mobile phone is acceptable than Gen-Xers or Millennials.  #mrx #SSIwebinar
Due to cultural differences, respondents were also less likely to state that reading or texting at dinner as unacceptable. #mrx #SSIwebinar

reputational harm: consider the topics that are appropriate for younger audience/ industry codes recommend parental consent #mrx #SSIwebinar
Youth surveys: confidentiality obligations would not be enforceable as in most countries under 18 can ‘void’ a contract #mrx #SSIwebinar
Incident response notification program–Review info security, ensure consistent definitions in policy–assign team members & roles #SSIwebinar
Incident response…Duty to notify individuals if there is a breach or unauthorized access in certain countries #mrx #SSIwebinar
Ask yourself what would surprise respondents about how data is being collected & used–there shouldn’t be any surprises #mrx #SSIwebinar
The value of respondent trust: lack of transparency about data collection & use may lead to a lack of willing participants #mrx #SSIwebinar
Respondents want their data protected & may react negatively to “creepy” tracking tools–unexpected data linkages–scraping of #social data
Heightened security requirements (in light of breach/hacker events): Cybersecurity laws on the legislative docket in the US #mrx #SSIwebinar
...More restrictive EU legislation pending: joint & several liability for data processors under new draft EU legislation #mrx #SSIwebinar
Future of privacy law–a regulator’s perspective–believe in Privacy by Design Principles & collection of MINIMALLY NECESSARY data #SSIwebinar
Mobile meters – highly ‘intrusive’ data collection including sensitive data and personal data of non-respondents #mrx #SSIwebinar
Passive listening–while it “listens” for the ads, it potentially collects other personal data during conversation #mrx #SSIwebinar
Cookies/tracking tags–using cookies both for online ad effectiveness research & developing audience insights based on browsing #SSIwebinar
The future of privacy law–a market researcher’s perspective: Big data/data appends–more robust profiles–more data analytics #mrx #SSIwebinar
Does respondent really understand what is happening & what is collected as their browsing behavior & searches are tracked #mrx #SSIwebinar
...Consider the Compete FTC case as a “precursor” to today’s meter #mrx #SSIwebinar
Considerations for meters/passive data collection– more prominent disclosure in addition to the privacy policy #mrx #SSIwebinar

Cookies:Users must be given clear notice & provide express consent to
Store info–Gain access to inform stored on PC/mobile #SSIwebinar #mrx
who (many players involved: developer, carrier, client, end client) is collecting the data & for what purpose #mrx #SSIwebinar
Challenges of ensuring respondent understands what data is being collected  (passively and directly)...#mrx #SSIwebinar

In the digital age, the concept of true “anonymisation” is lost says Quirk
#mrx #SSIwebinar
Privacy laws govern–Collection, use & sharing of personally identifiable information(PII) specific to US–laws vary globally #mrx #SSIwebinar
